event: pocket infection of his cardiac resynchronization therapy defibrillator
erythema around his left upper chest implant site
discomfort around his left upper chest implant site
edema around his left upper chest implant site
serosanguinous drainage around his left upper chest implant site
severely reduced left ventricular systolic function
global hypokinesis of the left ventricle
leads were scarred to the lateral wall of the superior vena cava
cardiac resynchronization therapy defibrillator pocket capsule was dissected out
coronary sinus and right atrial leads were extracted
bleeding was manually controlled with pressure
5-mm tear in the superior cavoatrial junction
oozing hematoma at the level of the innominate vein
repair with multiple 4-0 polypropylene sutures with pledgets
right ventricular lead was capped and abandoned
transfusions of cryoprecipitate, platelets, fresh frozen plasma, and factor VII
bilateral, symmetrical cyanotic changes to all 5 digits of his upper and lower extremities
surface pallor and coldness in the affected areas
upper- and lower-digit ischemia had progressed to dry gangrene
no ability to move his fingers and toes
Doppler study showed flat waveforms on all digits and toes bilaterally
liver enzymes returned to normal limits
necrotic lesions were treated conservatively with povidone-iodine dressings
purulent, foul-smelling material from his left infraclavicular operative site
stabilized and transferred to our facility
laser extraction of his retained lead
pus was drained from the subfascial area within the infraclavicular space
microbial cultures grew Enterobacter cloacae and Staphylococcus epidermidis
transvenous implantable cardioverter-defibrillator system was implanted
evaluation of his hands and feet revealed no signs of local infection or wet gangrene
black skin changes and demarcation lines were clearly defined
frank mummification of his digits and toes
amputation and debridement of his necrotic feet
amputation of his fingers is scheduled
